item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 8, 2025 at 2:45 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Magic/tragic email links: don't make them the only option (314 points | 185 comments)
2. Mistakes engineers make in large established codebases (243 points | 130 comments)
3. Show HN: Tramway SDK – An unholy union between Half-Life and Morrowind engines (445 points | 155 comments)
4. A day in the life of a prolific voice phishing crew (34 points | 7 comments)
5. Show HN: HipScript – Run CUDA in the browser with WebAssembly and WebGPU (171 points | 23 comments)
6. Automated accessibility testing at Slack (32 points | 7 comments)
7. Ending our third party fact-checking program and moving to Community Notes model (541 points | 831 comments)
8. Hyperview – Native mobile apps, as easy as creating a website (16 points | 5 comments)
9. A video tour of the Standard Model (2021) (63 points | 4 comments)
10. Physicists Magnetize a Material with Light (114 points | 39 comments)
11. Collusion through Common Leadership [pdf] (121 points | 60 comments)
12. Streets GL – 3D OpenStreetMap (48 points | 6 comments)
13. When will we fix the tools that run the world? (19 points | 12 comments)
14. A minimax chess engine in regular expressions (495 points | 89 comments)

19. Nvidia announces next-gen RTX 5090 and RTX 5080 GPUs (447 points | 598 comments)
20. How is my Browser blocking RWX execution? (12 points | 5 comments)
21. Laid off for the first time in my career, and twice in one year (127 points | 94 comments)
22. OmniAI (YC W24) Hiring Engineers to Build Open Source Document Extraction ( | hide)
23. Type 2 Diabetes and cardiovascular disease attributable to sugar beverages (220 points | 203 comments)
24. Oracle Will Not Voluntarily Withdraw JavaScript Trademark (53 points | 21 comments)
25. Choosing an op-amp for your project (138 points | 73 comments)
26. USB On-The-Go (172 points | 82 comments)
27. Preventing conflicts in authoritative DNS config using formal verification (46 points | 2 comments)
28. Online Behavioral Ads Fuel the Surveillance Industry (99 points | 46 comments)
29. Securing Web Sites Made Them Less Accessible (8 points | 2 comments)
30. Stimulation Clicker (2806 points | 542 comments)
